poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
The body is simple and good It is always the infant, always itself - Though sometimes two rivers will find the one bed.
The mind is nothing more than Nothing wrapped in a rainbow flag. And nothing was wrong: Not these lights, these limbs.
The crimson sign that you impressed on me Was fever on the wind. The riverboat beats upstream, the shoals divide.
This is my body, and to understand The just conclusion that you drew It hurt like a toothache, till I found That it had made me the simplest sign of all.
